content.rendered:
PSA unboXed offers you access to an extensive network of PSA expertise, resources and opportunities to unbox your idea into a sustainable business with a go-to-market strategy.

We are looking to improve efficiencies and explore new spaces in port operations and supply chain adjacencies through the application of novel technology and innovative solutions and invite you to co-create technology solutions for the logistics industry, supply chain and toward our vision for our container port of the future.

PSA unboXed focuses on LogTech solutions as envisioned in our CP4.0™ technology blueprint – we view the intelligent container port in the 4th industrial age enabled by real-time connectivity, data-orchestrated operations as an integral component of the supply chain. We want to provide for our stakeholders:

PORTS

  • Smart engineering e.g. autonomous and automated systems for container operations
  • Data-driven orchestration of port and resource optimisation
  • Enabling better collaboration amongst community
  • Pre-emptive health, safety & security

LOGISTICS AND SUPPLY CHAIN

  • IoT and non-sensor based cargo visibility
  • Trade finance
  • Trade compliance
  • Digital workflows and e-documents
  • Innovative digital trucking solutions
  • Specialist cargo handling e.g. cold chain, pharmaceuticals, chemicals, e-commerce

ENTERPRISE

  • Business analytics and intelligence
  • Cybersecurity
  • Future of work
  • Organisational effectiveness

SUSTAINABLE ENVIRONMENT

  • Decarbonisation
  • Circular economy

We invite you to co-create this Container Port of the Future with PSA unboXed, or apply your solutions to the broader supply chain. Send your idea to psaunboxed@globalpsa.com.

Loading...

  • CP4.0TM

    Transformational Blueprint of the Port of The Future

Engage Us

We work primarily with start-ups at different levels of maturity, in a multitude of ways, including:

Collaborate

Explore product market fit, POCs, trials, implementation, co-creation of solutions and other collaboration opportunities.

Invest

Venture capital financing for solutions relevant to PSA’s current and future businesses. ‎‎‎‎‎‎‎

‎

Mentors

We offer you access to an extensive network of PSA domain experts, technology and VC partners to unbox your idea into a sustainable business with a go-to-market strategy. Validate your ideas in our global network of ports, or with our related logistics partners.

ELTON FONGVice President
PSA unboXed
Read Profile

ELTON FONG

 

Elton Fong is the Vice President and leads PSA unboXed, the external innovation and venture capital arm of PSA International, which seeks to nurture technology and innovation from startups globally with a focus on logistics, ports and maritime.

 

Elton joined PSA in 1998 in the then newly created Supply Chain Management Department. There, he developed logistics solutions for clients, including a Track and Trace solution in collaboration with Savi Technologies and Manugistics, and a supply chain management system for then the largest exporter in Singapore – The Polyolefin Company.

 

Within PSA, Elton moved on to a business development role with a stint in container terminal operations where he managed a part of the Singapore business operations. In business development, he plays a key role in the expansion of PSA business overseas in line with its long-term objectives, including identifying, evaluating and recommending prospective acquisitions, mergers or joint ventures, as well as identifying and leading/assisting the development of new business opportunities.  Elton was involved in a number of container terminal investment projects across the world, including successful ventures by PSA in Turkey, India, Argentina, Colombia, Cuba and Panama. Since 2010, Elton was responsible for the origination of PSA’s new businesses in the Americas region, including structuring and negotiating investment deals.

 

Elton was awarded the PSA Overseas Scholarship and received a Bachelor of Science Degree (1st Class Honours) in Economics from the London School of Economics and Political Science.

ONG KIM PONGRegional CEO Southeast Asia
PSA International
Read Profile

ONG KIM PONG

 

Ong Kim Pong is currently the Regional CEO of Southeast Asia in PSA International. He has overall responsibility and accountability for PSA Group’s portfolio of operating terminals, investments and expansion in Southeast Asia including PSA Singapore which has seen major productivity improvements and deployment of technology. He sits on the Senior Management Council of PSA International. In addition, he is an active member of Next Generation Port 2030 Steering Committee (NGP 2030), International Maritime Centre 2030 Advisory Committee (IMC 2030), Management Board of the Centre for Maritime Studies (CMS), and the Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) Board.

 

Prior to his current position, Kim Pong was the Regional CEO of Northeast Asia (NEA) over a span of five years since 2010 where he successfully led the NEA team in the strategic management of PSA’s portfolio in China, Hong Kong and Korea while prospecting new possibilities including the consolidation of China’s Fuzhou Terminals to the establishment of Lianyungang-PSA Container Terminal (LPCT) and Guangxi Beibuwan-PSA International Container Terminal Co., Ltd (BPCT), PSA’s latest joint venture in China aligning to China’s One-Belt One-Road initiative towards South East Asia.

 

In 2009, Kim Pong was appointed as the Managing Director of PSA’s flagship project in Antwerp, Belgium responsible for its business activities and day-to-day operations. Concurrently, he was also the Executive Director of PSA Zeebrugge, Belgium.

 

In his previous capacity, Kim Pong consecutively held the position of Senior Vice President, PSA Mediterranean & Middle East South Asia Region, then Managing Director / CEO of Mersin International Port (MIP) in Turkey. During his tenure with MIP, he distinguished himself by ensuring a smooth transition of ownership of the Mersin Port from the local government to PSA and helped establish MIP as a key gateway port in the eastern Mediterranean. MIP was conferred the Lloyd’s List Turkey Port of the Year Award in 2008. Since the acquisition, MIP has received numerous accolades from the port industry. During that tenure, Kim Pong was, in parallel, called to lend support to the commercial and operational issues that were occurring in PSA terminals in Italy and India.

 

As the pioneer for PSA in Belgium, Kim Pong served as Chief Operating Officer for Hesse Noord Naatie N.V. (HNN) in Belgium from 2001 to 2004 where he played an instrumental role in guiding the merger of two of the biggest port operators in Belgium to form HNN and effectively doubling its port capacity during the period. He successfully led the negotiation and formation of MSC Home Terminal JV between MSC and PSA. HNN was subsequently re-named as PSA Antwerp and PSA Zeebrugge in 2009.

 

Kim Pong holds a Masters of Business Administration from the National University of Singapore. He is married with three children.

GOH MIA HOCKHead of Group Process Excellence &
Group Technology
PSA International
Read Profile

GOH MIA HOCK

 

Goh Mia Hock is Head of Group Process Excellence. He oversees Group level functions including Operations Development, IT, Health, Safety, Security & Environment (HSSE); and is senior advisor to Group Corporate Affairs. He also sits on the Senior Management Council of PSA International.

 

In his Group Operations Development and Group IT portfolios, Mia Hock provides the leadership in deriving global port operational and IT synergies and spearheading innovation for the PSA Group. He promotes the sharing of operations, engineering and IT knowledge across all PSA ports globally, and conducts operational-related due diligence for business development projects. He is actively involved in procuring terminal equipment and operating systems, and has set up various mechanisms to facilitate Group procurement of equipment and spares. Mia Hock and his team oversee the benchmarking of terminal productivity, monitor trends and conduct studies into future terminal equipment and operating systems. His team also works with line departments to provide a safe, secure and sustainable work environment, adopting a systematic HSSE framework and propagating a positive HSSE culture throughout the PSA Group.

 

Mia Hock also plays an advisory role to Group Corporate Affairs and provides guidance on policies, media and crisis communications guidelines for consistent corporate branding and messaging across the PSA Group. He has held an active role in Group Corporate Affairs as its Senior Vice President up until 2010.

 

Mia Hock built his career with PSA over the last 20 years. He worked through the ranks and acquired broad management experience through rotation via various functions and assignments including the planning for the Pasir Panjang Terminal, strategic planning, market and operations research, corporate services (corporate communications, legal & secretariat services) and maritime security. Mia Hock’s in-depth knowledge of the business and operations has enabled him to formulate and implement Group-wide policies with a holistic view and a pragmatic approach. He has also developed a strong network with government ministries and agencies in Singapore.

 

Prior to his current appointment, Mia Hock was Senior Vice President for Planning from 1999 through 2004 in PSA Corporation, and has also served as the Company Secretary of PSA International.

WAN CHEE FOONGRegional CEO Middle East South Asia
Head of Group Business Development
PSA International
Read Profile

WAN CHEE FOONG

 

Wan Chee Foong is the Regional CEO of Middle East South Asia and the Head of Group Business Development. He works closely with PSA International’s Group CEO in leading strategy work in the area of Global Commercial. Chee Foong is also involved in Group Business Development in growing the global footprint of PSA.

 

Chee Foong joined PSA on 23 April 2012, bringing with him a broad range of business development and investment experience in transport, as well as in the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) sector.

 

Prior to PSA, Chee Foong spent more than eight years in Temasek Holdings, an Asia investment firm headquartered in Singapore. Chee Foong focused on investments in the transportation sector, and led teams in the evaluation and execution of investment opportunities, restructuring and nurturing of investee companies. His last appointment with Temasek was as Director for SeaTown Holdings, a USD3bn global investment fund wholly owned by Temasek. Chee Foong led the establishment of SeaTown’s investment platform, and in addition, he also managed a portfolio of public and private investments in the transportation, consumer, soft commodities and oil services sectors.

 

Chee Foong had a stint at Diageo PLC, to setup the business development team in the Asia-Pacific regional headquarters. He was responsible for the evaluation and execution of acquisitions, joint ventures and partnerships in the FMCG sector.

 

In the early years of his career, he was with Singapore Airlines (SIA) holding various management positions in the commercial technology, sales & marketing and internal audit divisions. Chee Foong was also seconded from SIA to start up ZUJI, an Asia-Pacific online travel services joint venture comprising of the major Asia-Pacific airlines and Travelocity.

 

Chee Foong was awarded the Singapore Airlines Scholarship and graduated from Stanford University.

HO GHIM SIEWHead of Group Commercial and Group Cargo Solutions
PSA International
Read Profile

HO GHIM SIEW

 

Ho Ghim Siew is the Head of Group Commercial & Cargo Solutions reporting to the Group CEO. She is a Senior Management Council Member of PSA International.

 

Ghim Siew primarily drives the PSA Group’s commercial strategies in support of its activities and relationships with key global shipping lines. She is responsible in developing and maintaining PSA’s overall group business strategy with a focus on major industry trends and potential shifts. Ghim Siew also leads Cargo Solutions Development for specific sectors of interest at the ports’ adjacencies, with key stakeholders and customers, and supported by the digital platform, CALISTA.

 

Ghim Siew has progressed in her career and held various management positions involving engineering, commercial, operations, contracts and supplier management, in PSA Singapore Terminals (ST) since 1997. Appointed as Head of Commercial in 2010, she was responsible for the business volume and yield in the container business in ST. She has notably played a key role in restructuring the ST’s major customer relationships in joint ventures and long term contracts.

 

She was also the mentor of a few talents from Operations and Engineering providing guidance and counsel on their personal career development.

 

Ghim Siew attended the National University of Singapore and graduated with a Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering. She is married with three children.

ANG CHENG KIATHead of Group IT
PSA International
Read Profile

ANG CHENG KIAT

 

Ang Cheng Kiat, Head of Group IT in PSA International, has overall responsibility for Information Technology for PSA group of companies globally.

 

Cheng Kiat is the key driver of PSA’s Group IT transformation since the setup of Group IT department in 2012.   He is responsible for the setup of Global IT team through integration of Global IT resources and charting the IT transformation strategy, directing the product roadmap for next generation Global Terminal Operating Systems and Global Enterprise Systems. He has spearheaded the creation of a global IT organisation with alignment to business strategy and agility in driving IT solutions. Under his leadership, Group IT serves as the process excellence enabler for PSA terminals by leveraging on and developing cutting edge technology to establish a competitive advantage in the industry.

 

Cheng Kiat was previously responsible for PSA e-commerce solutions with the customers and driving the integration of processes with the shipping community. He has also held positions in IT strategy and planning, Quality Management and Corporate Systems. He has led the team in winning the National Infocomm Awards for most innovative use of Infocomm Technology in 2006 – Singapore highest accolade for Infocomm innovation.

 

Prior to joining PSA, he was a Regional Director for E-commerce and Information Strategy in Neptune Orient Lines (NOL), and was responsible for the development and implementation of IT, e-commerce products and solutions in the region. He led the IT initiatives with customers in streamlining the internal and customer-facing processes. He was also a member of the management team that developed the global information strategy.  He has held positions in IT regional Director, management of computerisation of global front line offices, IT transformation projects and business process re-engineering projects for global offices.

 

Cheng Kiat has also previously held position as board director in IT and Logistics companies.

 

Cheng Kiat graduated with a Bachelor of Science (Computer and Information Sciences) (Honours) and a Master of Business Administration.

CHEANG CHEE KITHead of Terminal Services
PSA Singapore
Read Profile

CHEANG CHEE KIT

 

Cheang Chee Kit is the Head of Terminal Services in PSA Group, based in Singapore. He leads a cluster with deep expertise in operational data analytics, container connectivity, outsourcing strategy and business continuity management to support Cargo Solutions, Container Divisions and Tuas. He has a direct reporting relationship to the Regional CEO of PSA South East Asia.

 

Chee Kit joined PSA in 1993 in the Business Development & Operations Department in Singapore Terminals. Since then, he has progressed in his career and held various management positions involving planning, logistics management, yard controls, and transshipment in the container port operations. He has successfully developed an operating model of linear berth stretch intensification with comparable service level and optimized the capacity of a unit with an additional stretch capacity. He equipped his team adequately in embracing higher volume during peak and the challenges for integrated ship and yard planning.

 

He was seconded to Group Process Excellence (GPE) as Vice President (GPE) for two years from January 2014 to December 2015, having the responsibility for Group Operations Development to support PSA overseas terminals in various regions. Chee Kit has been instrumental in shaping the progress of PSA Group towards more integration and alignment especially in the area of operations analytics, identification of good and bad practices and computation of terminal capacity. In addition to his interest in solving problems on the ground, Chee Kit teaches the overseas terminals to be problem-solvers themselves.

 

He was managing director of Singapore Terminals 1 from January 2016 to February 2020 and played an instrumental role in creating a future-ready workforce with the successful transition of more than a thousand staff from Singapore Terminals 1 aka City Terminals to the newer terminals, at the same time equipping them with new skills. He remains passionate and engaged to grooming his people to build new capabilities and break boundaries riding on agility and velocity.

 

Chee Kit holds a Bachelor of Science Degree major in Biochemistry and Microbiology from National University of Singapore.

 

Chee Kit is married with two children.

EDDY NGHead of Group Commercial & Supply Chain Sustainability Solutions
PSA International
Read Profile

EDDY NG

 

Eddy Ng is the Managing Director of PSA Singapore’s Container Division, which comprises the group of operational container terminals at City Terminals and Pasir Panjang Terminals (PPT) 1-6, including the recently commissioned automated facilities at PPT.

 

Eddy is responsible for the overall business and operations management for all these terminals in PSA Singapore, which is the hub of choice for the world’s mega shipping alliances and home to many shipping port joint venture companies, and boasts an annual consolidated capacity of over 40 million Twenty-foot Equivalent Units (TEUs) of containers. In preparing for future terminal development in the upcoming Tuas Terminal mega port, Eddy actively supports the capacity planning and expansion of PSA Singapore’s existing terminals, pushing research and development through the ‘PSA Living Lab’ @ PPT1 which is a dynamic test bed to operationalise new technologies and digital capabilities.

 

Eddy is the Chairman of the Board for SP-PSA International Port, a joint-venture terminal facility in Cai Mep, Vietnam, and a board member of Vopak Terminal Singapore.

 

Eddy is married with two children.

LAWRENCE NGRegional Head of IT, Southeast Asia
PSA Singapore
Read Profile

LAWRENCE NG

 

Lawrence Ng leads the Regional IT Southeast Asia (RIT SEA) team that oversees IT operations of the business units within the SEA region. As the head of RIT SEA, he is responsible for promoting the rollout of PSA IT products, systems and technologies, in line with PSA Group IT strategies through providing technical leadership and guidance to the local BU IT teams.

 

Lawrence joined PSA in 1996 as a System Analyst, specializing in the area of ICT Infrastructure. He progressed through the ranks and has since held management positions across various ICT functions, ranging from infrastructure to application development. In his illustrious career with PSA, he has established a solid track record of successful project implementations. He has been instrumental in the evolution of ST’s mission critical CITOS® system and has played a key role in establishing the foundation (people, process & technology) needed to attain extreme levels of availability, reliability and resiliency.

 

Not one to rest on his laurels, Lawrence is constantly seeking innovative improvements that might be realized through the integration of technology and process. He has championed many other internal initiatives, ranging from new technology deployment, business process transformation and governance.  Apart from his technical proficiency, he is regarded as a good people developer and constantly seeks to motivate people to perform at their best.

 

Lawrence holds a Bachelor of Science degree with Honours in Computer Science & Information Systems from National University of Singapore. He is married with two children.

EDDIE NGVice President (Group Platform Development)
PSA International
Read Profile

EDDIE NG

 

Eddie Ng is currently VP Group Platform Development in PSA International. He has the overall responsibility and accountability of PSA Group’s Platform Development and partnership. He works closely with customers and government agencies to support the platform development. He is also a member of Global Shipping Business Network (GSBN) consortium’s Governance Board.

 

Prior to his current position, he was Head Strategic Liner Management of APL where he led the Asia, US & Europe Regional Cargo Flow Teams as well Yield Management Team in Singapore. He was a member of APL Innovation Committee and led proof-of-concept initiatives in the application of blockchain technology and Artificial Intelligence (AI). He also collaborated with local Universities in research ranging from booking velocity to short-term projection of vessel utilisation.

 

Eddie has more than 20 years of international experience in container shipping and logistics industry. He has held management positions in NOL/APL/APLL across Asia, Europe and Americas and has served a variety of roles of increasing responsibility covering marketing, pricing, alliance & network planning, group corporate planning, eCommerce, logistics product management and yield & cost management. He has initiated and implemented enterprise-wide transformational project covering integrated demand forecasting, network optimisation and end-to-end shipment & inventory visibility. He also pioneered customer profitability at individual box level and auto-pricing for shipping through machine learning.

 

Eddie holds a Master of Business Administration (MBA) and a Bachelor Science (Hons) (Computer & Information Science) from the National University of Singapore.

MELVIN CHIAVice President, Container Division
PSA Singapore
Read Profile

MELVIN CHIA

Melvin Chia is currently the Vice President of Pasir Panjang Terminals 4-6. Fully equipped with automated yard cranes, Pasir Panjang Terminals 4-6 is the newest facility in PSA Singapore and boosts an annual combined handling capacity of 16 million Twenty-footer Equivalent Units. Other than overseeing the business portfolio and operations, Melvin concurrently leads the frontline manpower planning for Container Division and is responsible for mapping out long-term and sustainable resourcing strategies. He also holds the position of President of PSA Alongside, a recreation and sports club of PSA Singapore, and sits on the Board of HPST, a joint venture between HMM and Singapore Terminals.

Over these 21 years in PSA, Melvin has played an instrumental role in uplifting the service quality of Container Terminals. He joined as an Operations Executive in 2000 and was rotated to various management roles in PSA Singapore including leading the Keppel Terminal team (2000-2008), the Operational Contracts team (2009-2012) and the Pasir Panjang Terminal team (2013-2015). In 2016, Melvin moved on to Group Operations Development under PSA International and successfully developed and cascaded refined workflows to business units worldwide. He moved on to his current portfolio in 2019.

Melvin has been a trailblazer for innovation and quality service standards. In 2017 and 2018, he led the ‘Global Innovation Awards’, one of PSA’s signature programme that spurs the workforce towards a culture of innovation. Today, he continues to advocate doing things differently, leads his team in overcoming unprecedented challenges and achieve new operational excellence standards. Under his stewardship, Melvin has strengthened the resilience of our internal & external labour structure and uplifted the operational capabilities through new work processes. A firm believer in people development, Melvin remains devoted in training, and continues to invest time and efforts in nurturing his team members into leaders of the future.

SEOW HWEEHead of Cargo Solutions Business, SEA
PSA International
Read Profile

SEOW HWEE

 

Seow Hwee is the Head of Cargo Solutions with PSA Corporation Ltd. The Cargo Solutions Division was recently established in 2020 as part of PSA’s strategic move to venture beyond the container business into other adjacencies. Leveraging the traditional domain capability in container handling at the waterfront as well as partnership built along the supply chain eco system, the Cargo Solutions Division seeks to understand cargo flow and supply chain pain-points so as to develop bespoke solutions to address these challenges both physically and digitally.

 

Prior to her new appointment, Seow Hwee held a diverse and wide variety of portfolio including berthing, connectivity, integrated operations resources management, haulier & chemcare services, data analytics, and foreign resource management. A pioneer with over 20 years of experience in the maritime industry, she has led both the set up of the present day Pasir Panjang Terminal as well as the PSA-Guangzhou Joint Venture Container Terminal in China.

 

Outside of work, Seow Hwee is active in grassroots and also volunteers as a counsellor with the Family Life Society.

ALVIN FOOHead of New Technologies and Sustainability
PSA Singapore
Read Profile

ALVIN FOO

 

Alvin Foo is currently the Head of New Technologies & Sustainability. He began his career with PSA as a mechanical engineer in 1998 and held several key managerial positions since then.

 

As Head of New Technologies & Sustainability, Alvin drives the strategizing, formulating and implementation of future ready technology capabilities for key verticals in automated & autonomous equipment, smart infrastructure, smart engineering and integrated platforms as well as green and sustainable logistics solutions for PSA Singapore.

 

He is responsible in delivering key sustainability thrusts such as low carbon emission strategies, carbon credits framework & exchange for maritime industry as well as catalyse, test-bed and implement solutions leveraging on low carbon technology, energy optimisation and digitalisation capabilities. Sustainable business practices, sustainable procurement as well as circular economy will be amongst his key focus areas. He will also work with shipping and cargo solution providers to optimize processes and decarbonise the value chain, build domain expertise in key industry verticals as well as derive strategic sustainability collaborations to extract commercial value.

 

Alvin is also a key member of a cross-functional team within PSA that is designing a strategic roadmap to ensure its staff is future-ready to handle the increasing complexity in developing and managing a fully automated terminal.

 

Alvin holds degrees in Mechanical Engineering and Electrical Engineering respectively from NUS and The University of Newcastle, Australia. He is also a certified productivity & innovation manager, and a IES Chartered Engineer in Port Engineering.

TAN TIAM HERAssistant Vice President (Engineering & Equipment Development)
PSA Singapore
Read Profile

TAN TIAM HER

 

Tan Tiam Her is the AVP of Engineering Division at the Singapore Hub Center within PSA International Group.

 

Tiam Her started out as a Mechanical Engineer at PSA in 1999, delivering reliable fleet of Container Handling Equipment through robust maintenance regime. Through the years, he has rotated across different equipment fleets including Quay Cranes, Yard Cranes and Mobile Equipment (Prime Movers and Trailers). In 2011, he was tasked as the Engineering lead for port equipment for the development of Phases 3 and 4 of the Pasir Panjang Terminal, growing the engineering department to a full-fledged team that looks after the fleet maintenance of Pasir Panjang Terminal 4 to 6.

 

Tiam Her currently leads both the Engineering Equipment Development Department (EEDD) and Smart System Solutions Department (SSSD). He oversees and sets design standards for equipment, automation systems, infrastructure and maintenance processes. His team also leads the development of autonomous horizontal transport (Prime Movers) for application in the port environment. He also synergises and charts technical development roadmaps, delivers automation and smart system solutions, as well as support the engineering solutions in Tuas Development.

 

Tiam Her holds a Bachelor Degree in Mechanical and Production Engineering with 1st Class Honours from Nanyang Technological University.

CHAK KONG SOONManaging Partner
STREAM Global Pte Ltd
Read Profile

CHAK KONG SOON

 

Chak Kong Soon has been in the ICT industry for almost 30 years. His passion in building and nurturing organisations led him to collaborate with several prominent individuals to start Stream Global Pte. Ltd. Stream Global is a local “Venture Catalyst” who’s main objective is to invest in and partner with entrepreneurs and assist them in realising their potential. In order to achieve this, Stream Global will assign relevant experience partners or individuals to work hands-on with the organisation. It is with this practical approach that Chak was the Managing Director of E1 Studio, a Singapore home grown interactive digital media company. In partnership with the Media Authority of Singapore (MDA) and the National Research Foundation (NRF), Stream Global jointly invests in start-ups both in Singapore and the region. In addition to being the Managing Partner of Stream Global, he is mentoring several ICT organisations in the region. Prior to this, he founded and ran a few companies; among them were Finesse Software, Finesse Alliance, Fuziq Pte Ltd, Elcom Software, and several others. He is also currently a Board Member on several technology companies in the region.

 

For his achievements in the Information Technology arena, Chak was presented the “Young Professional of the Year” at the IT Leader Awards in 1999. He was a finalist in the Rotary-Association of Small and Medium Enterprise Entrepreneur of the Year Award in 1999. He is an Honorary Fellow in the Singapore Computer Society (SCS). He is currently the Immediate Past President of the Singapore Computer Society. Chak is currently serving as a Board Member of the Institute of System Sciences of the National University of Singapore and Advisory Board of the Digital media and Information Technology School of Singapore Polytechnic. He also served as Board Member in the Advisory Board of National University of Singapore’s School of Computing.

 

Chak also participated as committee member in various committees chaired by organisations like Infocomm Development Authority of Singapore (iDA), Media Development Authority of Singapore (MDA) and the Singapore Computer Society (SCS). He also served as a Board Member in the External Examiner Board for Certified IT Project Management (CITPM) examination.

JAMES TANManaging Partner
Quest Ventures
Read Profile

JAMES TAN

 

James Tan is managing partner of Quest Ventures, a leading venture fund for technology companies. Prior to this, James was co-founder and COO of 55tuan (NASDAQ listed), one of China’s largest e-commerce companies with an annual transaction volume near $1 billion.

 

Quest Ventures was the first or one of the earliest investors in today’s trailblazers such as 99.co, Burpple, Carousell, Ethis, KeyReply, Oddle.me, ShopBack, Spiking, Lenda, Vulcan Post, and Xfers.

 

He has held various engineering and product roles in two-sided markets at SCS (now NCS), JPMorgan Chase and Nets. James has also served as trustee or board director on many organisations and companies, including Action Community for Entrepreneurship, Beijing Software Industry Association, Applied Innovation Institute, and startups in China and Southeast Asia.

 

James was recognised as an outstanding overseas Chinese by the Overseas Chinese Affairs Office of the State Council of China; and a finalist in the Australia China Alumni Award for Entrepreneurship. He has been guest speaker at China-centric and entrepreneurship events such as Global Entrepreneurship Week, ITB Berlin, TechinAsia, TDS Asia, and Web In Travel. He is a mentor at Chinaccelerator, Founder Institute, IBM SmartCamp, and SPH Plug and Play. He has lectured or is a regular guest lecturer at UC Berkeley, HKUST, IE, NUS and Tsinghua University.

 

James is a graduate of University of South Australia and as a Beijing government scholarship and Singapore government fellowship recipient, received his MBA from Tsinghua University in partnership with MIT. He studied and dropped out of information systems and computer science at the National University of Singapore.

 

For leisure, James is a photographer and has shot commercially, featured in magazines such as ComputerWorld and Readers’ Digest and represented by Liaison Agency (now Getty Images). He backpacks Asia and volunteers in marine conservation as a PADI scuba-diving and DAN dive-safety instructor.

RAYMOND CHOONGPartner
FocusTech Ventures
Read Profile

RAYMOND CHOONG

 

Raymond Choong is a technology investor, a digital transformation expert and advisor to technology startups, with over 26 years of experience in investment, finance, operational, Supply Chain, eCommerce and internet-based fields. He has been working with Ooredoo Group (OG), a leading Middle Eastern telecom group, and also with Singapore Technologies Telemedia (STT), a Temasek-linked company, for the last 16 years.

 

At OG, Raymond was a key member in the digital transformation at the group level and in implementation in a subsidiary. In the last two years, he was involved in driving the internet-economy in the Middle East, China and Southeast Asian regions via partnerships and joint ventures, and initiating a technology accelerator programme and a venture capital fund.

 

While at STT, Raymond was responsible for aligning strategy and long-term planning across the group businesses, as well as managing the company’s cross-border investments and overseeing the strategic investments for the group. He was a member of the initial team that initiated the Internet Data Center (IDC) business in its infancy. He played a key role in initiating and leading investments in the areas of Internet/Digital Transformation (such as eCommerce, Fintech, Big Data), Telco “Over-The-Top” (OTT) Players, submarine cable operators, cable/broadband TV operators, IDCs, and wireless/fixed-line providers and operators in China, Asia Pacific and Middle Eastern markets.

 

Previously, Raymond has held various senior corporate development and management roles. At Creative Technology, a Singapore-based global technology company, he managed eCommerce and product development. At Kaga Electronics, a Japanese, Tokyo-listed company specializing in electronics and IT products distribution, he established the Singapore office, running sales and operations in the area of contract management and supply chain management.

 

Raymond is currently a mentor at SiTF’s123 JumpStart, SPH Plug & Play (a media and technology-focused accelerator programme), UOB’s Finlab (a Fintech-focused accelerator programme) and the TNB Accelerator and Airmaker (an Internet of Things-focused, cross-border accelerator programme).

 

Raymond speaks fluent English, Mandarin & Cantonese.

Portfolio

Provides control and visibility across B2B supply chain and informs all parties of shipment’s proof of delivery

App-powered marketplace transporting goods to businesses across SEA

International digital platform simplifying cross-border trade

Digital container trucking for SEA

Better Supply Chain Visibility & Intelligence

Pre-built software bots focusing on logistics and supply chain industries

Cross-border e-commerce operator focusing on China market

Exit

Supply chain SaaS to gain global freight transportation visibility & logistics efficiency

Partners

About PSA unboXed
PSA unboXed is the external innovation and corporate venture capital arm of PSA International. PSA unboXed was formed in 2016, and is a wholly owned subsidiary of PSA International. Send us a deck, or speak to us about your idea at psaunboxed@globalpsa.com
About PSA International
PSA International (PSA) is a leading port group and trusted partner to cargo stakeholders. With flagship operations in Singapore and Antwerp, PSA’s global network encompasses over 50 locations in 26 countries around the world. The Group’s portfolio comprises more than 60 deepsea, rail and inland terminals, as well as affiliated businesses in distriparks, warehouses and marine services. Drawing on the deep expertise and experience from a diverse global team, PSA actively collaborates with its customers and partners to deliver world-class port services alongside, develop innovative cargo solutions and co-create an Internet of Logistics. As the partner of choice in the global supply chain, PSA is “The World’s Port of Call”.

Visit us at www.globalpsa.com.
